References¶

All class references.

Database¶

Database manipulation class.

Database manager¶

Handle database basic operation using sqlalchemy.

Logs all error in exception object. exception.logger: logger object. exception.message: error message.

class database_manager.DatabaseManager(configuration, prefix='', **kwargs)¶

Manage database interaction, Logs all error.

add(entity)¶

Add one entity into current database, flush and expunge it. Raise and log exception in case of error.

Parameters:entity (obj) – Entity class with data to feed database.
add_all(entities)¶

Add list of entity into current database, flush and expunge it. Raise and log exception in case of error.

Parameters:entities (list) – List of entity class with data to feed.
bulk_insert_mappings(obj, data)¶

Execute a bulk insert of data.

Parameters:
  • obj (obj) – Class representing table schema.
  • data (list) – list of dict representing data to add.
bulk_save_objects(data, return_defaults=False)¶

Execute a bulk save of data.

Parameters:data (list) – list of table object with data to add.
create_schema(name)¶

Create given schema, log and raise exception in case of error.

Parameters:name (str) – name of schema.
create_table_obj(name, *, schema=None, autoload=True)¶

Create an sqlalchemy table object.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – name of table.
  • schema (str) – table schema name. Default to None.
  • autoload (bool) – autoload table structure. Default to True.
delete(entity, merge=False)¶

Delete one entry, raise and log exception in case of error.

Parameters:entity (obj) – Entity instance to delete.
drop_schema(name)¶

Drop given schema, log and raise exception in case of error.

Parameters:name (str) – name of schema.
entity_exists(filter)¶

Check if an entity exists on given filter, raise exception in case of error.

Parameters:entity (obj) – filter to apply to where clause.
Returns:True if exists otherwise False.
map_tables(tables, *, schema=None)¶

Map tables into python object, log and raise exception in case of error.

Parameters:
  • tables (list) – list of tables name to map.
  • schema (str) – table schema name. Default to None.
Returns:

list of python object containing tables schemas.
read(table)¶

Read all entry for one table, expunge and return it. Raise and log exception in case of error.

Parameters:table (obj) – Entity class with table schema.
Returns:list of database entry as entity class. None in case of error.
schema_exists(name)¶

Check if schema exists.

Parameters:name (str) – schema name.
Returns:True if exists otherwise False.
session(*, raise_err=True, session_config=None)¶

Context manager for session, yield a session then commit, in case of error log exception and rollback session.

Parameters:
  • raise_err (bool) – raise exception in case of error if True. Default to True.
  • session_config (dict) – session configuration.
update(entity, keys)¶

Update entity, select by id. Raise and log exception in case of error.

Parameters:entity (obj) – entity object to update.
Paran list keys:
 list of keys to update.

Singleton for database manager. Use this class like a DatabaseManager.

Logging¶

Custom logging setup and utils.

Logging decorator¶

Suite of decorator for logging.

logging_decorator.err_lambda_logger(level, *, start=None, end=None, err=None, log_err=True)¶

Decorator for logging before and after function execution. Decorated function must be method in class with logger attribute. Log with exception level if decorated func raise an exception.

Parameters:
  • level (str) – level of logger.
  • start (func) – string to log before function exec, default: None.
  • end (func) – string to log after function exec, default: None.
  • err (func) – string to log if exception is raised, default: None.
  • log_err (bool) – log error if True, default: True.
logging_decorator.err_simple_logger(level, *, start=None, end=None, err=None, log_err=True)¶

Decorator for logging before and after function execution. Decorated function must be method in class with logger attribute. Log with exception level if decorated func raise an exception.

Parameters:
  • level (str) – level of logger.
  • start (str) – string to log before function exec, default: None.
  • end (str) – string to log after function exec, default: None.
  • err (str) – string to log if exception is raised, default: None.
  • log_err (bool) – log error if True, default: True.
logging_decorator.lambda_logger(level, *, start=None, end=None, err=None)¶

Decorator for logging before and after function execution. Decorated function must be method in class with logger attribute.

Parameters:
  • level (str) – level of logger.
  • start (func) – string to log before function exec, default: None.
  • end (func) – string to log after function exec, default: None.
  • err (func) – string to log if exception is raised, default: None.
logging_decorator.simple_logger(level, *, start=None, end=None, err=None)¶

Decorator for logging before and after function execution. Decorated function must be method in class with logger attribute.

Parameters:
  • level (str) – level of logger.
  • start (str) – string to log before function exec, default: None.
  • end (str) – string to log after function exec, default: None.
  • err (str) – string to log if exception is raised, default: None.

Logging filters¶

Custom filters for logging

class logging_filters.LvlFilter(low, high)¶

Custom filter based on level.

filter(record)¶

Determine if the specified record is to be logged.

Is the specified record to be logged? Returns 0 for no, nonzero for yes. If deemed appropriate, the record may be modified in-place.

Logging handlers¶

Custom handlers for logging.

class logging_handlers.SlackHandler(token, channel, proxies)¶

Handler for slack.

emit(record)¶

Send message on slack channel.

Logging level¶

Custom level for logging.

class logging_level.LoggingLevel¶

Custom logging level. All method are static so they can dynamically inherit from the logger they are used by.

Attr dict name_to_level:
 static dict to define reference between name and level.
static mail(self, message, *args, **kwargs)¶

Custom level for mail logging.

static slack(self, message, *args, **kwargs)¶

Custon level for slack logging.

add_custom_constructors(custom_constructors)¶

Add custom constructors to yaml.

Parameters:custom_constructors (dict) – custom constructors to add as key: tag, value: func.
add_getter_constructor(name, data)¶

Set a yaml constructor to get data from other yaml.

Parameters:
  • name (str) – name of the getter.
  • data (dict) – data dictionary to get from.

  • yaml_dir_path (str) – path directory for all yaml files.
